meanings.definition: A white crystalline substance used to season or preserve food.
meanings.sent1: I sprinkled some salt on my fries to make them tastier.
meanings.sent2: The chef always keeps a jar of salt handy in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pepper refuse to play with the salt? Because it was too salty!
meanings.sent4: Her words were like salt, adding flavor to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The salt on the table shimmered under the light, inviting me to season my meal.

meanings.definition: To add salt to food in order to enhance flavor.
meanings.sent1: Remember to salt the soup before serving it.
meanings.sent2: She likes to salt her popcorn for a savory snack.
meanings.sent3: The comedian decided to salt his jokes with a pinch of sarcasm.
meanings.sent4: His stories always seemed to be salted with a hint of exaggeration.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to a delicious dish is to salt it just right.

meanings.definition: To preserve food by treating it with salt.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used to salt meat to keep it from spoiling.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman salted the fish to prepare it for storage.
meanings.sent3: The idea to salt the vegetables for winter came from an old recipe.
meanings.sent4: She decided to salt the cucumbers to enjoy them for a longer time.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of salting food has been passed down for generations.

meanings.definition: A person considered to be dependable or loyal.
meanings.sent1: She is the salt of the earth, always there to help others.
meanings.sent2: In times of need, you can rely on him; he is the salt of the group.
meanings.sent3: The salt of the team, he always gives his best in every game.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship is like salt, adding flavor to my life.
meanings.sent5: He proved to be the salt of the family, holding everyone together in tough times.

meanings.definition: To add zest or liveliness to something.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to salt up the party with some fun games.
meanings.sent2: The music helped to salt up the atmosphere at the event.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to salt up his routine with a new joke.
meanings.sent4: His presence always seemed to salt up the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The painting needed something to salt it up and make it more interesting.
